description.value:
Trigger A creature falls into the pool

Effect More water pours forth from the chalice. Creatures in the pool become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.Clumsy]{Clumsy 1}, and they can't decrease their clumsy condition so long as they remain in the pool. The trap then rolls initiative.

details.description: The pool sucks in creatures that fall into it, making them sink into its endless depths.
details.disable: @Check[type:diplomacy|dc:32|name:Calm the Pool] (master) or @Check[type:deception|dc:32|name:Calm the Pool] (master) to quell the fear and calm the pool or @Check[type:intimidation|dc:35|name:Scare the Pool] to give the pool something worse to fear; three successes required.
details.reset: The trap resets once there are no moving creatures in it.
details.routine: (3 actions) Water from the chalice increases the depth of the water by 10 feet for each action. Each time this happens, creatures in the pool are pushed 10 feet down and take [[/r 1d6[bludgeoning]]] damage. As the pool has no bottom, creatures in it can fall down indefinitely; they must @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.Swim] up to avoid drowning, but the water is especially choppy, so the Athletics DC is @Check[type:athletics|dc:25|traits:action:swim]. The pool never overflows. Each successful check to Disable reduces the pool's actions by 1, and once the pool is completely Disabled, the water becomes still and the Athletics DC to Swim becomes @Check[type:athletics|dc:10|traits:action:swim].
